civilopediaText.text: Own 3 Factories to unlock an Ideology

name: Airport
uniques: Provides [1] [Tourism] <for every [1] [[Great Work] Buildings]> <in this city>

name: Caravansary
uniques: [+2 Gold] from each Trade Route <on foreign continents>

name: Hotel
uniques: Provides [1] [Tourism] <for every [1] [[Great Work] Buildings]> <in this city>

name: Cloves
uniques: Only available <in cities without a [Palace]> <hidden from users>
Only available <in cities without a [Nutmeg]> <hidden from users>
Only available <in cities without a [Pepper]> <hidden from users>
Automatically built in all cities where it is buildable <hidden from users>
Limited to [1] per Civilization <hidden from users>
Will not be displayed in Civilopedia
Never destroyed when the city is captured <hidden from users>

name: Nutmeg
uniques: Only available <in cities without a [Palace]> <hidden from users>
Only available <in cities without a [Cloves]> <hidden from users>
Only available <in cities without a [Pepper]> <hidden from users>
Automatically built in all cities where it is buildable <hidden from users>
Limited to [1] per Civilization <hidden from users>
Will not be displayed in Civilopedia
Never destroyed when the city is captured <hidden from users>

name: Pepper
uniques: Only available <in cities without a [Palace]> <hidden from users>
Only available <in cities without a [Nutmeg]> <hidden from users>
Only available <in cities without a [Cloves]> <hidden from users>
Automatically built in all cities where it is buildable <hidden from users>
Limited to [1] per Civilization <hidden from users>
Will not be displayed in Civilopedia
Never destroyed when the city is captured <hidden from users>

name: Royal Library
uniques: New [Military] units start with [10] XP [in this city]

name: Amphitheater
uniques: Destroyed when the city is captured

name: Cathedral
uniques: Can be purchased for [200] [Faith] [in all cities in which the majority religion is a major religion]
Destroyed when the city is captured

name: Monastery
uniques: [+1 Culture, +1 Faith] from [Wine] tiles [in this city]
[+1 Culture, +1 Faith] from [Incense] tiles [in this city]
Can be purchased for [150] [Faith] [in all cities in which the majority religion is a major religion]
Destroyed when the city is captured

name: Mosque
uniques: Can be purchased for [200] [Faith] [in all cities in which the majority religion is a major religion]
Destroyed when the city is captured

name: Pagoda
uniques: Can be purchased for [200] [Faith] [in all cities in which the majority religion is a major religion]
Destroyed when the city is captured

name: Ducal Stable
uniques: New [Mounted] units start with [15] XP [in this city]
[+15]% Production when constructing [Mounted] units [in this city]
[+1 Production, +1 Gold] from [Cattle] tiles [in this city]
[+1 Production, +1 Gold] from [Horses] tiles [in this city]
[+1 Production, +1 Gold] from [Sheep] tiles [in this city]

name: Ikanda
uniques: Destroyed when the city is captured
New [Military] units start with [15] XP [in this city]
All newly-trained [Sword] units [in this city] receive the [Buffalo Horns] promotion

name: Lighthouse
uniques: [+1 Production] from [Water resource] tiles [in this city]

name: Mausoleum of Halicarnassus
quote: 'The whole earth is the tomb of heroic men and their story is not given only on stone over their clay but abides everywhere without visible symbol woven into the stuff of other men's lives.' - Pericles

name: Temple of Artemis
uniques: [+15]% Production when constructing [Archery] units [in this city]
quote: "It is not so much for its beauty that the forest makes a claim upon men's hearts, as for that subtle something, that quality of the air, that emanation from the old trees, that so wonderfully changes and renews a weary spirit."' - Robert Louis Stevenson

name: Hanging Gardens
quote: 'I think that if ever a mortal heard the word of God it would be in a garden at the cool of the day.' - F. Frankfort Moore

name: The Pyramids
quote: 'O, let not the pains of death which come upon thee enter into my body. I am the god Tem, and I am the foremost part of the sky, and the power which protecteth me is that which is with all the gods forever.' - The Book of the Dead, translated by Sir Ernest Alfred Wallis Budge

name: Statue of Zeus
quote: 'He spoke, the son of Kronos, and nodded his head with the dark brows, and the immortally anointed hair of the great god swept from his divine head, and all Olympos was shaken' - The Iliad

name: Sydney Opera House
quote: 'Those who lose dreaming are lost.' - Australian Aboriginal saying

name: Globe Theatre
quote: 'Totus mundus agit histrionem' - Inscription above main entrance to the Globe Theatre

name: Great Mosque of Djenne
uniques: All newly-trained [Missionary] units [in this city] receive the [Devout] promotion
All newly-trained [Great Prophet] units [in this city] receive the [Devout] promotion
quote: 'With the magnificence of eternity before us, let time, with all its fluctuations, dwindle into its own littleness.' - Thomas Chalmers

name: Machu Picchu
uniques: Must have an owned [Mountain] within [2] tiles
quote: 'Few romances can ever surpass that of the granite citadel on top of the beetling precipices of Machu Picchu, the crown of Inca Land.' - Hiram Bingham

name: Forbidden Palace
quote: 'Most of us can, as we choose, make of this world either a palace or a prison' - John Lubbock

name: Petra
uniques: [+1 Food, +1 Production] from [Desert] tiles without [Flood plains] [in this city]
quote: '...who drinks the water I shall give him, says the Lord, will have a spring inside him welling up for eternal life. Let them bring me to your holy mountain in the place where you dwell. Across the desert and through the mountain to the Canyon of the Crescent Moon...' - Indiana Jones

name: Terracotta Army
quote: 'Regard your soldiers as your children, and they will follow you into the deepest valleys; look on them as your own beloved sons, and they will stand by you even unto death.' - Sun Tzu

name: Alhambra
uniques: All newly-trained [relevant] units [in this city] receive the [Drill I] promotion
quote: 'Justice is an unassailable fortress, built on the brow of a mountain which cannot be overthrown by the violence of torrents, nor demolished by the force of armies.' - Joseph Addison

name: Big Ben
uniques: [Gold] cost of purchasing items in cities [-15]%
quote: 'To achieve great things, two things are needed: a plan, and not quite enough time.' - Leonard Bernstein

name: The Louvre
quote: 'Every genuine work of art has as much reason for being as the earth and the sun' - Ralph Waldo Emerson

name: Porcelain Tower
quote: 'Things always seem fairer when we look back at them, and it is out of that inaccessible tower of the past that Longing leans and beckons.' - James Russell Lowell

name: Statue of Liberty
uniques: [+1 Production] from every specialist [in all cities]
quote: 'Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free, the wretched refuse of your teeming shore. Send these, the homeless, tempest-tossed to me, I lift my lamp beside the golden door!' - Emma Lazarus

name: Great Firewall
quote: 'Distrust and caution are the parents of security.' - Benjamin Franklin

name: Kremlin
uniques: [+50]% Production when constructing [Armored] units [in all cities]
quote: 'The Law is a fortress on a hill that armies cannot take or floods wash away.' - The Prophet Muhammed

name: Red Fort
quote: 'When we build, let us think that we build forever.' – John Ruskin

name: Borobudur
uniques: Can only be built <in [in holy cities] cities>
quote: 'When you realize how perfect everything is, you will tilt your head back and laugh at the sky.' – Gautama Buddha

name: Artists' Guild
uniques: Destroyed when the city is captured

name: Musicians' Guild
uniques: Destroyed when the city is captured

name: Writers' Guild
uniques: Destroyed when the city is captured

name: National Visitor Center
uniques: Provides [2] [Tourism] <for every [1] [[Great Work] Buildings]> <in this city>
Cost increases by [30] per owned city
Only available <if [Hotel] is constructed in all [non-[Puppeted]] cities>

name: East India Company
uniques: Cost increases by [30] per owned city

name: Uffizi
quote: 'The painter is not simply someone who looks and who sees. Above all, the artist is someone who exposes a personal vision by rendering it visible.'  - Marcel Parquet

name: Prora
quote: 'This loss (of freedom) means the fading from human life of values infinitely precious to it. There only remain ironbound conditions of employment and trivial amusements for leisure.'  - A.N. Whitehead

name: Sistine Chapel
quote: 'I live and love in God's peculiar light.' - Michelangelo Buonarroti

name: Eiffel Tower
quote: 'We live only to discover beauty, all else is a form of waiting'  - Kahlil Gibran

name: Museum
uniques: Double quantity of [Tourism] produced <in [Capital] cities> <for [France] Civilizations> <hidden from users>
Destroyed when the city is captured

name: Opera House
uniques: Destroyed when the city is captured

name: Ceilidh Hall
uniques: Destroyed when the city is captured

name: Broadcast Tower
uniques: Destroyed when the city is captured

name: National Epic
uniques: Only available <if [Monument] is constructed in all [non-[Puppeted]] cities>
Cost increases by [30] per owned city

name: Heroic Epic
uniques: Only available <if [Barracks] is constructed in all [non-[Puppeted]] cities>
All newly-trained [non-[Air]] units [in this city] receive the [Morale] promotion
Cost increases by [30] per owned city

name: The Great Library
quote: 'Libraries are as the shrine where all the relics of the ancient saints, full of true virtue, and all that without delusion or imposture are preserved and reposed.' - Sir Francis Bacon

name: Oxford University
uniques: Only available <if [University] is constructed in all [non-[Puppeted]] cities>
Cost increases by [30] per owned city

name: Hermitage
uniques: Only available <if [Opera House] is constructed in all [non-[Puppeted]] cities>
Cost increases by [30] per owned city

name: Ideology
uniques: Comment [Visit the Policies Screen to select an Ideology]
Automatically built in all cities where it is buildable <hidden from users>
Will not be displayed in Civilopedia
Moves to new capital when capital changes <hidden from users>
Unavailable <before the [Modern era]> <when number of [[Factory] Buildings] is less than [3]>
Only available <in cities with a [Palace]> <hidden from users>
Limited to [1] per Civilization <hidden from users>
